text: Hi, I’m Francis,
the host of this show "Cooking with Dog."
Today, we will be making Komatsuna Nibitashi, lightly seasoned leafy greens, blanched for a short time.
This is a quick and easy recipe and will help you to make one more green side dish.
Separate the stems and thoroughly rinse them.
First, cut the leaves of the komatsuna into about 4cm or 2 inch pieces.
With a paper towel, remove the excess oil and moisture
from the aburaage, thin deep-fried tofu.
Cut the aburaage into strips.
Next, pour the dashi stock into a pot.
Add the sake,
sugar
and soy sauce.
Turn on the burner and stir the mixture.
Add the aburaage
and the stems of the komatsuna,
and distribute evenly.
Bring it to a boil
and simmer for about 1 minute until the stems soften.
Then, add the dried whitebait
and the komatsuna leaves.
Submerge the leaves in the broth
and then mix the ingredients evenly.
When the leaves turn a vibrant color, the dish is ready to serve.
Place the greens into a bowl.
Finally, pour the broth over the dish.
Komatsuna is rich in calcium
and has a mild flavor so it doesn’t require pre-boiling.
Alternatively, napa cabbage, bok choy, cabbage
or mizuna can be used in this recipe.
This cooking method reduces the volume of greens, allowing you to enjoy lots of vegetables.
The dashi stock made from whitebait and aburaage makes the dish exceptionally delicious!
Atsuage, thick deep-fried tofu or satsumaage, deep-fried fish cake
can be substituted for the aburaage.
Good luck in the kitchen.
